overview: In the mid 1950s, a local Los Angeles television show that does weekly interviews with B-list, Hollywood celebrities, is going to Vermont to interview Hollywood’s premiere horse trainer, Richard Turgidson (Jack Barron) and his wife, Kitty (Delaney Spink). What separates Richard from other horse trainers is that he invented a device that can intercept horse’s thoughts and transfer them out audibly, giving him the ability to have a conversation with them. However, for some reason, the horses always have British accents.
title: Conservative Horses
